| <<define>>                                      | content_classification_056 | How is bias managed within your AI and Machine Learning models?                                                                                                                                                                                                               | Open Field    | Channel Factory employs a comprehensive framework to manage and mitigate bias in its AI and Machine Learning models, which includes techniques across various stages of model development, deployment, and ongoing monitoring. Here’s an overview of the mechanisms in place:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | nan          |
|                                                 |                            | i.e. regular bias audits, diverse training datasets, human-in-the-loop verification, bias mitigation algorithms, explainability and transparency, continuous monitoring and improvement, collaboration with external partners:, user feedback and reporting mechanisms, other |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 1. Diverse and Inclusive Training Datasets: Global, Multi-Language Dataset: Channel Factory’s models are trained on a dataset comprising millions of video transcriptions across 49 languages, ensuring diverse linguistic and cultural representation.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 2. Dual Oversight on Sensitive Content: Human reviewers provide an additional layer of quality assurance, particularly for high-stakes content or culturally nuanced topics. This hybrid approach ensures the model’s automated classifications are accurate and that sensitive content is handled appropriately .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 3. Bias Mitigation Algorithmme Adjustments with Continuous Feedback Loops: Real-time feedback mechanisms in the ViewIQ platform adjust targeting parameters based on live campaign data, enabling continuous model improvement. For example, if specific content categories or keywords produce unexpected engagement metrics, the model dynamically adjusts its approach .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 4. Explainability and Transparency: Channel Factory provides clients with transparent metrics, allowing them to audit campaign performance and brand safety classifications. This transparency enables clients to assess suitability standards directly and to provide feedback for further customization .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 5. Third-Party Verification: For additional assurance, we can work with your third-party verification partners like IAS and DoubleVerify. This collaboration offers an independent validation of brand safety classifications, helping identify and mitigate any inadvertent bias within the system.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 6. Quarterly Bias Audits: assess the model’s suitability classifications to ensure they align with evolving industry standards and cultural contexts. Adjustments are made based on these audits to refine both suitability criteria and inclusion/exclusion lists.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |              |
| <<define>>                                      | content_classification_057 | Diversity and Representation in Training Data: How is diversity and representation ensured in the training data, and are there imbalances that could lead to biased outcomes?                                                                                                 | Open Field    | Conscious Voices Initiative: Channel Factory’s Conscious Voices initiative supports diverse communities and includes creators from a range of backgrounds, such as Black, Latinx, AAPI, and LGBTQ+ creators. By actively monetizing content from these communities, Channel Factory ensures their datasets represent a broad spectrum of perspectives and content types​.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | nan          |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | Custom Inclusion Lists for Diversity: Inclusion lists within the Conscious Project feature diverse creators across categories of equity, diversity, and inclusion, reflecting content aligned with various cultural and social identities.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |              |
| <<define>>                                      | content_classification_058 | Handling Sensitive Topics: How are sensitive topics and controversial subjects managed to avoid reinforcing stereotypes?                                                                                                                                                      | Open Field    | Proximity Filtering and Brand Alignment: For sensitive topics, Channel Factory uses proximity-based filtering to ensure ads do not appear directly before or after controversial or stereotypical content. They adjust placements to maintain brand alignment with positive, non-stereotyped messages, minimizing associations that could affect brand perception.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | nan          |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | Grey Content Classification: To navigate “grey areas” in content classification, Channel Factory defines nuanced boundaries that vary based on each brand’s tolerance for sensitive or potentially controversial content. For example, they separate content that might invoke visceral reactions (like “mukbang” or ASMR) from more universally safe material, allowing for targeted exclusions where necessary.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |              |
| <<define>>                                      | content_classification_059 | Bias Measurement and Minimization: What strategies are used to measure and minimize bias in AI models, and how is ongoing monitoring and improvement ensured?                                                                                                                 | Open Field    | Quarterly Bias Audits: Channel Factory conducts audits on a quarterly basis to review model performance, focusing on identifying any unintended biases that may arise. These audits assess whether certain content categories, demographics, or languages are disproportionately favored or excluded. The ViewIQ platform continuously tracks engagement metrics like view-through rate (VTR) and cost per view (CPV) in real time. If biases are detected in campaign performance, adjustments are made dynamically to improve content alignment with brand goals .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | nan          |
| <<define>>                                      | content_classification_060 | Cultural and Contextual Bias: Does your AI system account for cultural bias, and how does the tool ensure accuracy and avoid bias in assessing context and semantics?                                                                                                         | Open Field    | Multilingual Content Analysis: Channel Factory’s ViewIQ platform analyzes a video and metadata across 49+ languages, allowing the AI to understand context accurately in diverse linguistic and cultural settings. This helps to avoid biases that might occur from language-specific or regional content interpretations​.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | nan          |

|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | Verified and Trusted Platforms: Channel Factory’s primary data sources include verified social media and video platforms like YouTube. Content is pulled from channels with reliable metadata and high engagement, reducing the likelihood of misleading or fabricated information. (YTMP PARTNERSHIP)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | Comprehensive Language Analysis: To avoid erroneous classifications from automated settings (e.g., platform mislabeling), Channel Factory relies on direct language analysis rather than default location-based classifications.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | Manual Vetting of High-Risk Content: Human reviewers play a crucial role in examining content for accuracy and reliability. Sensitive or high-stakes content goes through a layer of human review to catch inaccuracies or potentially misleading content that automated models may miss                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | Real-Time Adjuserging Content: For new or viral content, Channel Factory’s team assesses suitability and quality to ensure that only trustworthy information is integrated. This proactive approach is especially useful for timely or fast-evolving topics .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | Dynamic Exclusion Lists Updates: Channel Factory’s ViewIQ platform dynamically updates exclusion lists every four hours, helping to filter out content that may later be deemed misleading or irrelevant based on real-time checks and ongoing data evaluations.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |              |
| <<define>>                                      | content_classification_063 | What quality control processes do you have in place for your training data?                                                                                                                                                                                                   | Open Field    | Channel Factory implements a rigorous quality control process for its training data to ensure that the AI models deliver accurate, safe, and brand-suitable ad placements. Key aspects of their quality control framework include:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | nan          |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 1. Source Verification and Content Validation: Channel Factory leverages our exclusive YTMP partnership with Youtube, where content is regularly vetted for adherence to platform standards. This strategy minimizes the likelihood of low-quality or misleading information influencing the training data​.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 2. Metadata and Contextual Analysis: Each piece of content undergoes a comprehensive metadata analysis, including factors like audience engagement, language, and content category, to validate its alignment with brand safety standards. This process leverages the YouTube API and other metadata resources to ensure that each channel and video meets quality benchmarks before inclusion​.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 2. Manual Review for High-Risk Content: Human reviewers play a crucial role in assessing content that may be sensitive or high-risk. This manual layer helps ensure that the AI model is exposed to content that aligns with brand values and prevents the inclusion of inappropriate data​.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 3. Quarterly Data Quality Audits: Channel Factory conducts regular audits on its datasets to identify any inconsistencies or quality issues. These audits are particularly focused on identifying and removing any outdated, irrelevant, or lower-quality data that may have entered the training pool​.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 4. Continuous Real-Time Updates for Dynamic Exclusion Lists: To adapt to the rapidly changing content landscape, Channel Factory updates its exclusion lists every four hours, filtering out any newly flagged or unsuitable content. This dynamic updating process ensures that the model only learns from high-quality and currently relevant data​.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |              |
|                                                 |                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |               | 5. Feedback Loop with Performance Data: Performance metrics, such as view-through rate (VTR) and engagement rates, are continuously analyzed. This feedback loop allows Channel Factory to adjust its data and targeting strategy based on real-world outcomes, enhancing the overall data quality in the training process​.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |              |

| <<define>>                                    | coverage_data_access_379 | Post Impression Measurement                                                                                               | Is there any additional information you would like to share that provides insight into your coverage and data access capabilities?                                                                                                                                    | Open Field    | We recommend our buys are measured by other third parties for unbiased reporting.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | nan          |
|                                               |                          |                                                                                                                           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |              |
|                                               |                          |                                                                                                                           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |               | Channel Factory does not offer post-impression in real time measurement, however Channel Factory offers content analysis and insights in a post-buy report that is available to advertisers that activate through our pre-bid solution. The report shows a split on categorization as well as scoring together with insights and recommendation on moving forward based on the previous buy.                                                                                                                                                                                       |              |
|                                               |                          |                                                                                                                           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |              |
|                                               |                          |                                                                                                                           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |               | In addition, ViewIQ holds insights into YouTube content, viewership and subscriber trends across all YouTube channels as well as historical metrics for the same. Advertisers can download and leverage this information freely. To summarize, Post-impression data, including video-level metrics, engagement, and suitability compliance, is accessible for clients. Channel Factory provides downloadable reports, and clients can independently review or cross-reference results within YouTube’s API-connected reporting systems.                                            |              |
| <<end>>                                       | nan                      | nan                                                                                                                       | nan                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | nan           | nan                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | nan          |

| nan                                       | nan                  | Questions                                                                                                                                                                                                             | Question Type | Response                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | nan          |
| <<define>>                                | Platform_Support_001 | What is your process for onboarding clients in Brand Safety governance, pre-bid and, post impression measurement solutions                                                                                            | Open Field    | Channel Factory’s onboarding process begins with a comprehensive needs assessment to understand each client’s brand safety, suitability, and performance objectives. A dedicated account manager and technical team configure the brand safety settings based on these requirements, setting up pre-bid controls, inclusion lists, and post-impression measurement configurations. Training sessions are provided for clients on using our platform, and we conduct periodic reviews to optimize brand safety controls and campaign performance. | nan          |
| <<define>>                                | Platform_Support_002 | Are pre-bid and post impression measurement  functionality housed in the same platform?                                                                                                                               | Open Field    | Yes, Channel Factory’s IQ series platform integrates both pre-bid and postbid measurement functionalities. With our seamless, IQ series platform - you are able to create a list, run media, optimize in real time as well access cross reporting across your campaigns. This platform allows advertisers the flexibility to switch between their campaign's impression threshold, measurments and also optimize performance.                                                                                                                    | nan          |
| <<define>>                                | Platform_Support_003 | What is the name/branding of your customer facing platform(s)?                                                                                                                                                        | Open Field    | The IQ series - ViewIQ is our contexual brand safety, suitability content platform, and ActivateIQ for Reporting, analytics and optimization. Both are seamlessly available on the same dashboard.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | nan          |

| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_019 | What is your engagement with other industry bodies for brand safety and suitability? Please explain                                                                                                                                               | Open Field    | Channel Factory is actively engaged with the Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) and has an ongoing commitment to obtaining the TAG Brand Safety Certification. Channel Factory aligns with industry standards through participation in the Trustworthy Accountability Group (TAG) and maintains awareness of best practices from organizations like the Brand Safety Institute (BSI) and Coalition for Better Ads (CBA).                                                                                                   | nan          |
|                                              |                         | i.e. Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB),Media Rating Council (MRC), Trustworthy Accountability Group (TAG), Brand Safety Institute (BSI)Coalition for Better Ads (CBA)                                                                          |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |              |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_020 | How do you define Made For Advertising (MFA)?                                                                                                                                                                                                     | Open Field    | Channel Factory defines MFA content as digital media primarily designed to generate advertising revenue without adding genuine value to the user. Such content typically lacks editorial integrity, original information, or substantial audience engagement, and it is driven by the sole purpose of monetization through ads.                                                                                                                                                                                              | nan          |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_021 | What measures do you implement to prevent ads from appearing on MFA sites, and how customizable are these measures for our brand?                                                                                                                 | Open Field    | Channel Factory prevents ads from appearing on MFA sites by using curated exclusion lists and contextual filtering based on engagement metrics and editorial quality standards. These filters are fully customizable, allowing clients to set parameters that align with their brand’s content quality and engagement criteria.  By default, Channel Factory excludes any and all MFA sites when advertising on YouTube.                                                                                                     | nan          |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_022 | How do you report on MFA site placements and their impact, and can you provide transparency on the proportion of ad impressions directed to MFA sites?                                                                                            | Open Field    | Channel Factory’s reporting includes transparency on placements and identifies MFA content based on engagement and quality metrics. Clients receive regular reports indicating the proportion of impressions directed to high-quality versus MFA sites, allowing them to assess and adjust brand safety settings accordingly.                                                                                                                                                                                                | nan          |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_023 | Are you able to identify exposure to current events or sensitive corporate issues beyond standard brand safety categories? If Yes, please provide details.                                                                                        | Open Field    | Yes, Channel Factory has the capability to track exposure to current events and sensitive issues. Using real-time content analysis, we can flag content related to sensitive or trending topics that may impact brand reputation.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | nan          |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_024 | Please describe your methodology for identifying such exposures.                                                                                                                                                                                  | Open Field    | Channel Factory uses keyword-based contextual analysis, news and sentiment tracking, and social listening to identify emerging topics. This includes real-time monitoring of keywords and content categories that relate to sensitive or high-risk topics, allowing us to flag exposure and adjust settings proactively.                                                                                                                                                                                                     | nan          |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_025 | What is your response time for addressing identified exposures to current events or sensitive corporate issues?                                                                                                                                   | Open Field    | Channel Factory’s response time is typically within a few hours. Our platform provides automated alerts for critical exposures, enabling rapid intervention. Our account teams coordinate with clients immediately to make necessary adjustments to inclusion/exclusion lists.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | nan          |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_026 | Can you help monitor brand-specific misinformation, such as boycotts and political conversations? If Yes, please provide details on your monitoring capabilities.                                                                                 | Open Field    | Yes, Channel Factory can monitor brand-specific issues through contextual analysis and sentiment tracking. This includes flagging content related to brand boycotts, political controversies, and misinformation, allowing clients to make informed adjustments to their ad placements.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | nan          |

|                                              |                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |              |

|                                              |                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |              |

|                                              |                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |               | Channel Factory’s roadmap emphasizes also a unified Cross-Platform Media Management solution, enabling end-to-end campaign oversight across major platforms like YouTube, Meta, TikTok, and others. By leveraging AI-powered optimizations, this system enhances performance metrics (such as engagement, viewability, and cost efficiency) and adapts brand suitability profiles to each platform’s unique environment.                                                                                                     |              |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_076 | What actions do you believe advertisers like P&G should take to help address industry challenges and gaps in brand safety and suitability?                                                                                                        | Open Field    | We recommend that advertisers actively engage in industry discussions, support transparency and data access standards, and advocate for higher accountability within ad networks. Collaborating with technology partners on shared standards can help drive industry-wide improvements.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | nan          |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_077 | Can you provide case studies or examples of how your governance, pre-bid, and/or post-impression measurement solutions have successfully mitigated risk for compliance? Please include specific outcomes and any metrics used to measure success. | Open Field    | Channel Factory is Procter & Gamble's Europe current partner of choice for YouTube pre-bid exclusion and inclusion list brand suitability setup. We currently collaborate with 95% of European countries, focusing on excluding child-directed content to enhance campaign performance and ensure ethical targeting by avoiding children as an audience.                                                                                                                                                                     | nan          |
|                                              |                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |               | By using the Channel Factory Brand Suitability Setup, an average of more than 10% of “context made for kids” has been excluded from European campaigns. In addition we work with pre bid Inclusion lists consisting of 20-100K channels, where Channel Factory guarantees and has proven, to be 99.99% compliant with P&G's brand safety and Brand Suitability guidelines and rules. With this we pro-actively mitigated all risks for compliance.                                                                           |              |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_078 | Are there any additional future challenges in the industry for brand safety and suitability that haven't been addressed in previous questions?                                                                                                    | Open Field    | Future challenges include balancing personalization with privacy, especially as regulations restrict data collection. There’s also an increasing need for nuanced brand safety filters that can keep pace with rapidly evolving digital platforms and emerging formats like live-streaming and AR/VR.                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | nan          |
| <<define>>                                   | Industry_Innovation_079 | Is there any additional information you'd like to share that provides insight into your thoughts on industry trends and innovation?                                                                                                               | Open Field    | Channel Factory believes the future of brand safety will be heavily driven by AI, allowing for faster adaptation to content changes and personalized suitability standards. As content types diversify, we foresee a shift toward predictive brand safety solutions that anticipate potential risks before they manifest, providing an added layer of protection for brands.                                                                                                                                                 | nan          |
| <<end>>                                      | nan                     | nan                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | nan           | nan                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | nan          |

| <<define>>                                | company_overview_033 | How is your Sales & Support team organized? i.e. Geography, Product Line, Industry, Customer Size, Other                                                                                                                                                                  | Open Field    | Channel Factory’s sales and support are organized by geography and product line. Teams are allocated to regions (e.g., North America, EMEA, InSEA, ANZ) and specialize in product offerings across YouTube, Meta, and TikTok, ensuring clients receive tailored support based on their regional and product-specific needs​.                       In addition Channel Factory operates with a dedicated global Brand Partnerships (BP) team that manages and services global clients. This team acts as the central point of contact for global discussions and hubbed campaign setups. This ensures machine learning communication and cohesive strategies that align with your global objectives. Additionally, our global media agency teams collaborate closely with the BP team to ensure alignment and success across all campaigns                                                                       | nan          |
| <<define>>                                | company_overview_034 | What is your approach or philosophy regarding Brand Safety and Suitability?                                                                                                                                                                                               | Open Field    | Channel Factory’s philosophy on Brand Safety and Suitability centers on proactive, inclusive, and context-driven advertising custom tailored to each of clients. We believe brand suitability is a tailored version of brand safety that differs per brand. ie Heineken wants to exclude driving and car content as they are an alcohol brand, where car manufacturers like BMW are targeting this kind of content actively. We use advanced proprietary tools like ViewIQ to ensure ads are placed in brand-safe environments, emphasizing positive content alignment and supporting diverse creators. Our inclusion-based approach moves beyond simple exclusion methods, allowing brands to engage meaningfully with growth audiences. With real-time AI-driven adjustments, our platform dynamically adapts to evolving content trends, ensuring continuous safety and relevance for our clients' campaigns. | nan          |
| <<define>>                                | company_overview_035 | What makes your capabilities and solutions unique compared to others in the industry?                                                                                                                                                                                     | Open Field    | Channel Factory’s unique advantage lies in its use of AI-driven lists, comprehensive inventory scanning, and real-time optimizations. Our approach provides complete control over ad placements, ensuring 99.99% brand safety coverage across multiple languages and local markets​. Channel Factory’s pre-bid suitability evaluates content before impressions are purchased, ensuring ads are placed in suitable environments. This proactive approach protects your brand, saves money through more efficient spending by targeting relevant inventory, and aligns campaigns with your brand values, ensuring relevance and safety from the start. In addition, Channel Factory has local agencies in most countries, delivering a local vision, a local view on content and local service by teams that speak the language.                                                                                  | nan          |
| <<define>>                                | company_overview_036 | Do you have an Equity and Inclusion strategy? If so, could you describe it, including any support for diverse suppliers and representation of minorities in the workforce?                                                                                                | Open Field    | Yes, Channel Factory’s “Conscious Advertising” initiative supports diverse creators, amplifying content from underrepresented groups and promoting DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) values. This strategy reflects in our campaigns, where we curate inclusive ad environments and encourage advertisers to reach growth audiences authentically​​. Have a look at our Conscious Business Performance (CBP) approach on our website.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | nan          |
|                                           |                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |              |
|                                           |                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |               | In addition to supporting equity and inclusion, Channel Factory is diverse owned supplier certified by the NMSDC (National Media Supplier Diversity Council).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |              |
| <<define>>                                | company_overview_037 | Have you worked with Procter & Gamble in the past? If so, please provide details on the timing, region, and scope of work.                                                                                                                                                | Open Field    | Channel Factory is Procter & Gamble's current partner of choice for YouTube pre-bid exclusion and inclusion list brand suitability setup. We currently collaborate with 95% of European countries, focusing on excluding child-directed content to enhance campaign performance and ensure ethical targeting by avoiding children as an audience. Additionally, we provide (hyper) contextual targeting to further optimize performance and campaign results.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | nan          |
|                                           |                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |              |
|                                           |                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |               | Our partnership with Procter & Gamble began in 2022 with initial tests of inclusion lists for pre-bid use, developed based on Procter & Gamble’s suitability and marketing guidelines. The success of these tests led to expanded inclusion list campaigns in 2023, achieving 100% guaranteed suitability and measurable performance improvements. Initially, we managed 20,000 channel lists, but through collaboration with Google/YouTube, we expanded this to 100,000 lists, delivering significant CPM and result enhancements.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |              |
|                                           |                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |              |
|                                           |                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |               | We also partnered on a comprehensive research project led by Procter & Gamble's measurement team in Geneva, exploring the impact of inclusion vs. exclusion lists. This research laid the foundation for the current setup active across nearly all European countries, where we primarily implement exclusion lists. Beyond Europe, we engaged with teams in the US and Singapore to discuss content strategy analysis, culminating in a presentation to the full media and marketing team in Singapore. This strategic insight aims to improve campaign performance and results in these regions as well.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |              |
| <<define>>                                | company_overview_038 | Could you provide a general overview of your company's financial health and growth outlook, focusing on stability and risk management?                                                                                                                                    | Open Field    | Channel Factory is financially robust with a diversified revenue base across YouTube, TikTok, and Meta platforms, supported by major brand partnerships in various industries. Positioned for growth, the company leverages rising demand for safe, inclusive, and contextually relevant advertising. Its expansion into 70+ countries and 40+ languages further enhances scalability. Risk management is integral to Channel Factory’s strategy, employing inclusion-based targeting for higher control and minimizing reputational risks. AI-driven optimizations and GDPR compliance bolster security and operational efficiency, ensuring stability and resilience in the digital advertising landscape​​​. Channel Factory is a privately owned company and therefore limited in sharing financial data, but upon request we can share certain insights on the solidity of the company.                     | nan          |
